author: KetteKaiser
body:
It’s not just the consumer grade chips from Intel/AMD. Their enterprise products tell a different story... slightly. 

Intel royally fucked things this year with numerous security/manufacturing/shittly made enterprise chips. They’re 3x the cost of AMD and can’t compete with threading.

AMD, however, is back from Intel’s shadow(again). They’re safer, better threading, faster, less overhead, and cheaper. A maxed out Intel powered management server from Dell is like $25k compared to the same Dell with AMD; $16k.

Look at tech companies that specialize in global architecture/networking/edge cache; e.x. Akamai, etc. expect them to move from intel to AMD as the year goes on and hardware is updated. eBay will end up with a bunch of Dell EMC servers filled with Intel chips. 

I definitely think that Intel will get their shit together. The two go back and forth every couple years (I’m looking at you Bulldozer/i7). Right now, though, AMD is a pretty safe long. 

TL;DR:
Look at their enterprise business. They do good. Good chips. UTZ+

author: reuhop
body: I recently sold ULTA cause it reached my target and now I don't know where to put the money. AKAM is also very close to my target. I use a stock screener and nothing on there is very interesting. Usually by the time I sell one stock another one comes up that looks promising. But not lately. I think everything is just over valued right now. I'll buy something soon as I see a good company show up on my screener.

author: IHeartPussyGunsMoney
body:
Internet traffic in China has slowed down to a trickle 😬😬
